job_tasks.phrase: deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase explicitly mentions processing and loading large datasets, which is a core aspect of data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
job_tasks.justification: ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) solutions are a fundamental part of data engineering for data movement and transformation.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
job_tasks.justification: This involves designing and implementing systems to deliver data, which falls under software development, particularly in the context of data architecture.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
job_tasks.justification: This describes full lifecycle software ownership and support, a key aspect of software development roles.

job_tasks.phrase: Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
job_tasks.justification: Focuses on building trustworthy software and applying security standards, which are crucial in software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
job_tasks.justification: Building deployment pipelines for CI/CD is a direct indicator of MLOps or DevOps practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
job_tasks.justification: Automating testing within the software development lifecycle aligns with operations engineering and MLOps principles.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
job_tasks.justification: Implementing observability and monitoring for product performance is a key responsibility in operations engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: These are all software development and operations tasks aimed at improving the development and deployment infrastructure.
Indicates a focus on a specific business domain (Credit Risk) and contributing to its advancement.

job_tasks.phrase: push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program.
job_tasks.justification: Suggests understanding the business needs and translating them into architectural improvements.

job_tasks.phrase: Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING.
job_tasks.justification: This directly outlines the business purpose and the value delivered to consumers within the organization.

job_tasks.phrase: play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
job_tasks.justification: Highlights the strategic importance and business function of the role within the bank.

soft_skills.phrase: We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing
you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture.

classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software development, data engineering, and MLOps tasks (ETL, CI/CD, containerization). While it mentions 'big data' and 'calculations,' there is no explicit mention or implication of using generative AI models, LLMs, RAG, or fine-tuning, which are central to the GenAI Engineer profile. The role is more aligned with a Data Engineer or a Software Engineer with MLOps experience.
